text.p: These are the leading stories in the Angolan press on Wednesday.
Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- The Angolan Secretary of Water and Energy, Joao Saraiva, on Tuesday presented parliament with information on a viability study of a hydroelectric project on the Cunene River, which forms the border between Angola and Namibia.
- U.N. special representative to Angola, Alioune Blondin Beye, met on Tuesday with the foreign diplomatic community in Luanda to brief them on Angola's ongoing peace process.
- The Angolan Supreme Court president, Jono Felizardo, met on Tuesday with U.S. ambassador to Angola, Donald Steinberg. The two discussed various problems confronting the judicial system in Angola.
- The Angolan Ministry of Defense issued an apology for an explosion at a military munitions dump outside Luanda which had resulted in civilian deaths and injuries.
